result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey D Bonner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey D Bonner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey D Bonner was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

*Successfully complete "Anger Management".
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 (seven) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
            
     *   Successfully complete "Anger Management".
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with 6333 W. Fond Du Lac Avenue or North Town Auto Repair.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due  
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   No firearms; weapons
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for sentencing hearing. Due to Court congestion / Judge unavailable. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for Sentencing Hearing. Judge unable to do sentencing on this date. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. State needs additional time to comply with victim notification. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel Mark Dluzak unavailable for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Chris K., Jessie H., or North Shore Auto Repair located at 6333 W. Fond du Lac, Milwaukee, WI.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Jeffrey D Bonner in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Defense moved to dismiss the entire complaint for lack of probable cause. Arguements heard.  Motion denied.  Defense moved to dismiss Count 2.  Agruements heard. Court grants motion to dismiss Count 2. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
